such.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: of the same kind as the thing or person which has already been mentioned
such.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Such behavior is just not acceptable in this school.
The rules make it quite clear what should be done in such a situation.
A victory for Brazil had been predicted, and such indeed was the result.
She needs to see a psychiatrist or some such person.
‘You said you’d be finished by today.’ ‘I said no such thing!’
There is now a greater awareness of problems such as these.
Birth is a natural process, and should be treated as such.
such.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to emphasize your description of something or someone
such.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: It’s such a long way from here.
such.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used to mention the result of a quality that something or someone has
such.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: It’s such a tiny kitchen that I don’t have to do much to keep it clean.
He came to such a sudden stop that we almost hit him.
such.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used to say that something is so great, so bad etc that something else happens
such.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: He lectured in such a way that many in the audience found him impossible to understand.
in such a way/manner that/as to do something
Her condition deteriorated to such an extent that a blood transfusion was considered necessary.
The force of the explosion was such that windows were blown out.
be such that/as to do something
His manner was such as to offend nearly everyone he met.
be such that/as to do something
such.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: used to show that you think that something is not good enough or that there is not enough of it
such.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: We will look at the evidence, such as it is, for each of these theories.
such as it is/such as they are etc
Such food as they gave us was scarcely fit to eat.
such.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used to refer only to people or things of a particular group or kind
such.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Such individuals who take up this role often find life frustrating.
Such of you as wish to leave may do so now.
such.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: You use such a before an adjective and a noun, or before a singular noun
I’m lucky to have such a wonderful teacher
He gave me such a fright
